H0.text: Numerous park areas would best help reduce the high levels of air pollution caused by the burning of fossil fuels in cities.

H1.text: Frequent trash recycling is an urban design that would best help reduce air pollution resulting from the burning of fossil fuels in cities.

H2.text: Efficient public transportation is the urban design that would best help reduce the high levels of air pollution caused by the burning of fossil fuels in cities.

H3.text: Effective street lighting is the urban design that would best help reduce air pollution caused by the burning of fossil fuels in cities.

A4.text: In the 2023 study titled 'Subways and CO2 Emissions: A Global Analysis with Satellite Data,' research reveals that subway systems significantly reduce CO2 emissions by approximately 50% in the cities they serve, contributing to an 11% global reduction.

A5.text: Using public transportation saves CO2 emissions in more ways than simply travel as public transportation can help to alleviate traffic congestion as well as promote more efficient land use. When all three of these are considered, it is estimated that 37 million metric tons of CO2 will be saved annually.
